OOC: This is where it gets interesting.  Beware, Wheelie has just rubbed Tu=
cson's scales the wrong way and btw, he IS RELATED TO RATCHET.  Which expla=
ins his temper.

BIC:  Tucson grits his teeth to try and stop himself from =
making a grave mistake.  Wheelie was practically sending him over the edge.=
  He could see it wasn't going to pan out with him after all.  Instead of g=
etting angry although agitation is in his voice, Tucson turns to Leo Prime =
and to Wheelie.

" This doesn't seem to be working well is it?  Sorry Wheel=
ie but if you can not work properly with command, I have no choice but to t=
ransfer you out of my sanction.  I've tried hard to avoid that but your ins=
olence only goes so far with me.  I'm sure another sanction will take you i=
n willingly, you have attributes they can use.  Leo, I trust you know someo=
ne who can use Wheelie, please see to the transfer if you could."

He turns=
 to Talon.

"I'm sorry you had to see this Talon.  I did try to keep my pat=
ience with him."

Straight Shot speaks up.  She looks at Wheelie completely=
 upset.

" Thanks a lot Wheelie!  My brother was trying really hard to reac=
h out to you and you go biting his hand off like a complete slag ball!  Tha=
nks to you he's on thin ice with the Autobot Council!  Now this!?  HOW COUL=
D YOU?!  I HAVE A GOOD MIND TA CARPET YOUR CHASSE WITH EVERY QUILL ON MY BO=
DY!" 

She darts out with tears in her eyes.  Rattrap tries to follow.  He =
stares at Wheelie.

" HAPPY NOW!?  GOOD!  I CAN'T WAIT TILL YOU GET THAT TR=
ANSFER! IF WINGS GETS BOOTED IT'S ON YOUR BACK BUMPER!" 

He too leaves the=
 room as upset as Straight Shot.

Tucson looks back at them.

" Leo, keep W=
heelie here, Talon, if you could, I could use your help.  I've never had to=
 console my sister and I could use some advice."

Nightshift comes back fro=
m his meditation at the river, only to almost hit Straight Shot, while stop=
ping short.  He knew right away what was troubling her.

" Uh oh, lemme gue=
ss, Wheelie huh?  Slag I knew that little bugger was trouble the moment he =
got here."

Straight Shot tries to compose herself.

" Yeah you called that=
 one right.  And because of him, Tucson could lose his status.  He's making=
 my brother look like a fool and worst off is,  Leo isn't doing anything ab=
out it.  Oh sure, ten ta one he's favoring Wheelie, I see it, I'm not stupi=
d.  Ooohhh!  This whole thing makes me so mad I wanna jab every quill on my=
 body into that little orange pest!"

Nightshift shifts into robot mode and=
 sits down with Straight Shot as does Rattrap , who puts a consoling arm ar=
ound her.

" Hey, I know things don't look so cool right now but I didn't h=
ear your bro lose his temper, and I know when he does because the whole bas=
e would've heard him.  That's why he's be'n watched and so far so good.  He=
 may have handled himself nicely in there, from what I can tell.  And that'=
s what the council looks for in a leader. "

Rattrap grins.

" Good point, =
never thought of it that way.  Oh Wings actually told Leo ta transfer him o=
uta the Ark and assign him to another troop."

Nightshift nods.

" That's c=
ool, at least he's still in the faction but different sanction.  Not bad.  =
Not bad at all.  I would've done the same thing if I was in his shoes.  Now=
, Straight Shot, don't worry, your bro ain't go'n anywhere but where he is =
now.  Trust me, as long as he keeps his temper in check and makes decisions=
 for the benefit of our troops he'll be fine."

He carefully puts an arm ar=
ound his prickly comrade.

Perpetually on the move and constantly busy. 

O=
n Aug 27, 2011, at 10:50 PM, "adamsafran" <adamsafran@...> wrote:

> =

> > An insult to his logic was definitely a test to Tucson's already short=
 temper.  Yet he knew he had to keep that in check if he was to keep his po=
sition. He turns to Wheelie with a narrowed brow. Yet not one word is said.=
 He then raises it.
> > 
> > " Hmmmm... So that's how you see me? If I'm no=
t mistaken Wheelie I believe you have just crossed the line of insubordinat=
ion. I'm giving you a chance to be part of the team but I see nothing in re=
turn on your part. Well, care to explain to me the Autobot code of honor an=
d what happens when a soldier behaves out of line, going as far as insultin=
g a Prime Officer? You seem to be quite intelligent, go on, tell me."
> > 
=
> > Rattrap and Straight Shot look to Wheelie in shock.
> > 
> > " Looks li=
ke a certain little go cart's in for some serious discipline. "
> > 
> > St=
raight Shot swallows hard.
> > 
> > " His voice, it sounds just like Ratche=
t's voice when he was ready ta lose it."
> > 
> > Rattrap watches with amus=
ement.
> > 
> > " Ooohhh so that's where Tucson's temper comes from. Yep Wh=
eelie is in big trouble."
> > 
> > Tucson eyes Wheelie with arms folded in =
his chest. His stare indicative of Ratchet when he was ready to lose his te=
mper.
> > 
> 
> At this point, Wheelie stood up, "Yes, I say you are wrong.=
 There's no such thing as a space bridge that strong. You would simply see =
it from afar, with our own optics the sensors abar. You cannot remotely hid=
e such a hting, in the technology of our time or even that thing. To do suc=
h a thing, to rip apart time, is stupidly absurd, I call it this time. So i=
f you are going to say we should waste our time going after what does not e=
xist, I say thee nay."
> 
> Wheelie went on, "So, stop wasting oru time for=
 such a stupid thing, or I will go out on my own and bring. Rodimus is my f=
riend, I won't leave him alone to face his end. If you are goin to be a bor=
on, then I shall call you a nimrod and boron."
> 
> Hissing, "Now, I would =
say you are wasting our time, on pointless things that we needn't to whine.=
 So I say, I think you want my friend dead today."
> 
> At the Laurel and H=
ardy back and forth of Rattrap and Straight SHot, Wheelie just laughed, "An=
d you bring up Ratchet? Well he's dead. MEgatron blew off his head. And you=
 seem to want Rodimus to end the same way. So I shall now not leave my frie=
nd astray."
> 
> And without a further word, Wheelie transformed to his veh=
icle mode, and raced off!
> 
> OOC - This is how I see the character - at t=
his point, he thinks it's utter nonsense to waste time looking for a Space =
Bridge that there's no evidence of or anything remotely suggesting, based u=
pon Tuscon having a 'hunch' so he's going insubordinate and off on his own.=
 TO him, a Space Bridge would e impossible to hdie (a la the third Transfor=
mers movie Dark of the Moon), and so wasting time scanning for it is a fool=
's errand. So he's going off to 'look' for Rodimus on his own, unless stopp=
ed or otherwis einterfered with as he's afraid that Tuscon is purposefully =
stalling to prevent them from going after Rodimus. He respects Leo Prime, b=
ut he's friends with Rorimus, and he has a very low regard for Tuscon, and =
at this point in his processor Tuscon deciding to check for something to hi=
m that has infinitesimal chances of having been done and stall a gridwide s=
earch is abaondment of his friend. Anyways, wondrful posting and good luck!=

> 
>

      <p><br>
> An insult to his logic was definitel=
y a test to Tucson's already short temper.  Yet he knew he had to keep that=
 in check if he was to keep his position.  He turns to Wheelie with a narro=
wed brow.  Yet not one word is said.  He then raises it.<br>
> <br>
>=
 " Hmmmm... So that's how you see me?  If I'm not mistaken Wheelie I believ=
e you have just crossed the line of insubordination.  I'm giving you a chan=
ce to be part of the team but I see nothing in return on your part.  Well, =
care to explain to me the Autobot code of honor and what happens when a sol=
dier behaves out of line, going as far as insulting a Prime Officer?  You s=
eem to be quite intelligent, go on, tell me."<br>
> <br>
> Rattrap an=
d Straight Shot look to Wheelie in shock.<br>
> <br>
> " Looks like a=
 certain little go cart's in for some serious discipline. "<br>
> <br>
&=
gt; Straight Shot swallows hard.<br>
> <br>
> " His voice, it sounds =
just like Ratchet's voice when he was ready ta lose it."<br>
> <br>
>=
 Rattrap watches with amusement.<br>
> <br>
> " Ooohhh so that's wher=
e Tucson's temper comes from.  Yep Wheelie is in big trouble."<br>
> <br=
>
> Tucson eyes Wheelie with arms folded in his chest.  His stare indica=
tive of Ratchet when he was ready to lose his temper.<br>
> <br>
<br>
At=
 this point, Wheelie stood up, "Yes, I say you are wrong.  There's no such =
thing as a space bridge that strong.  You would simply see it from afar, wi=
th our own optics the sensors abar.  You cannot remotely hide such a hting,=
 in the technology of our time or even that thing.  To do such a thing, to =
rip apart time, is stupidly absurd, I call it this time.  So if you are goi=
ng to say we should waste our time going after what does not exist, I say t=
hee nay."<br>
<br>
Wheelie went on, "So, stop wasting oru time for such a s=
tupid thing, or I will go out on my own and bring.  Rodimus is my friend, I=
 won't leave him alone to face his end.  If you are goin to be a boron, the=
n I shall call you a nimrod and boron."<br>
<br>
Hissing, "Now, I would say=
 you are wasting our time, on pointless things that we needn't to whine.  S=
o I say, I think you want my friend dead today."<br>
<br>
At the Laurel and=
 Hardy back and forth of Rattrap and Straight SHot, Wheelie just laughed, "=
And you bring up Ratchet?  Well he's dead.  MEgatron blew off his head.  An=
d you seem to want Rodimus to end the same way.  So I shall now not leave m=
y friend astray."<br>
<br>
And without a further word, Wheelie transformed =
to his vehicle mode, and raced off!<br>
<br>
OOC - This is how I see the ch=
aracter - at this point, he thinks it's utter nonsense to waste time lookin=
g for a Space Bridge that there's no evidence of or anything remotely sugge=
sting, based upon Tuscon having a 'hunch' so he's going insubordinate and o=
ff on his own.  TO him, a Space Bridge would e impossible to hdie (a la the=
 third Transformers movie Dark of the Moon), and so wasting time scanning f=
or it is a fool's errand.  So he's going off to 'look' for Rodimus on his o=
wn, unless stopped or otherwis einterfered with as he's afraid that Tuscon =
is purposefully stalling to prevent them from going after Rodimus.  He resp=
ects Leo Prime, but he's friends with Rorimus, and he has a very low regard=
 for Tuscon, and at this point in his processor Tuscon deciding to check fo=
r something to him that has infinitesimal chances of having been done and s=
tall a gridwide search is abaondment of his friend.  Anyways, wondrful post=
ing and good luck!<br>
<br>
</p>
